results.title: Treasure Island
results.brief_description: Based on the book by Robert Louis Stevenson, the story of Jim Hawkin’s hair-raising journey across the High Seas, complete with treasure maps, mystery and Long John Silver.

results.title: Treasure in the pyramid
results.creator_credit: Vaclav Bedrich, Marta Sichova and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: An animated parody of the “thriller” serials of the silent film era. The intrepid hero Lucius and his sweetheart Zea run foul of a sinister band of robbers who are plotting to steal the hidden treasure in an ancient Mayan pyramid. Heroic rescues, overwhelming odds, and fates worse than death are all part of the plot.

results.title: Treasure gardens with Alan Titchmarsh
results.creator_credit: Treasure House Group and Tadpole Lane
results.brief_description: Gardening expert Alan Titchmarsh takes you on an armchair journey through the grounds and gardens of eight of England’s historic houses. Included on the journey are the Broadlands in Derbyshire, Palace in On Walk at Harewood House; Yorkshire, Castle Howard, the Beaulieu estate in Hampshire, Woburn Abbey in Bedfordshire and the Peacock and Rose Gardens at Warwick Castle. Rhododendrle]

results.title: Treasure from the sea
results.brief_description: The Dow-perfected process of manufacturing magnesium by using a formula in which sea-water is a component is shown in this film. The effects of a wider use of magnesium in industrial and domestic life are also shown, and the advantages for both producer and consumer are presented.

results.title: Treadle and bobbin (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The machine, in one form or another, has become such a household necessity that we tend to forget the wonder and magic of the days when it was just beginning to earn its place by the hearth. The first suave ambassador from the court of mechanical efficiency to woo and win Grandma’s heart was the redoubtable sewing machine. Whirring and purring in the parlour, its virtuoso performance beguiled both young and old. Without commentary.

results.title: Trawling
results.brief_description: An account of methods used by British trawlers; map showing ports from which trawling is carried on; views of port and preparations for trip; leaving the port; preparing the nets; shooting a net; action of net under water and how fish are caught; hauling in the net; gutting and packing the fish; landing the catch.

results.title: Travelling North (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Carl Schultz, Ben Gannon and View Pictures
results.brief_description:
‘Travelling North’ (adapted for the screen by David Williamson from his award winning play) is the story of one man’s struggle to retain his dignity in the face of adversity. Leo McKern plays Frank, a crotchety old man who has an unending zest and passion for life. Julia Blake is Frances, his much younger companion who watches helplessly as Frank enters a traumatic period in his life - unable to understand the complexity of his personality and his strong desire to live life to the fullest.
Cast also includes: Graham Kennedy as Freddy, Henri Szeps as Saul, Michele Fawdon as Helen, Diane Craig as Sophie, Andrea Moor as Joan, Drew Forsythe as Martin, and John Gregg as Jim.

results.title: Travelling light. Parklands [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Kathryn Millard, Helen Bowden, Soft Fruit, Showtime Australia, South Australian Film Corporation, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Travelling Light: Set in Adelaide in the 1970s comes writer/director Kathryn Millard’s debut feature film. Leanne Ferris (Pia Miranda) is supposed to be embracing her studies to become a teacher but is caught up in the social change and dynamism of the era when women and youth, in particular, were finding a new generation’s independence. The restrictive nature 1970s Australian society places on the married women in her life (Mum and elder sister Bronwyn) infuse Leanne with a drive to find her own path by becoming a photographer. Sexual forays, drug taking and poetry help shape Leanne’s young adulthood. Cast includes: Sacha Horler, Tim Draxl, Marshall Napier, Heather Mitchell, Simon Burke, Kestie Morassi, Tamblyn Lord. “Parklands” [307794]: Rosie (Cate Blanchett) is a young woman who returns to her home in Adelaide for her father’s (Tony Martin) funeral. This intriguing short film follows the path Rosie takes to solve the mystery of her father’s death. Talking with old friends, looking through diaries and photographs - reliving her childhood, she comes to understand the life of the man she called her father.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kathryn Millard, Helen Bowden, Soft Fruit, Showtime Australia, South Australian Film Corporation, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Film Finance Corporation Australia

results.title: Travelling in Yugoslavia
results.creator_credit: Helen Canu, Ian Hamilton and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: Until very recently Yugoslavia was a popular tourist destination. This documentary reveals the beauty of the land with its ski resorts, beautiful coastal towns on the Adriatic coast, breath-taking mountain scenery in the Plitvice Lake region and the splendour of structures like the historic Kalamegdan fortress in the heart of Belgrade. The video takes us to Zagreb, Ljubljana, Plitvice, Dubrovnik, Sarajevo, Bled, Mostar and Belgrade.
